terms.definition: Large Language Model - an AI system trained on vast amounts of text data to understand and generate human-like text responses
The systematic process of creating, organizing, storing, and sharing information and expertise within an organization
Technical documentation that explains how to use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface, including endpoints, parameters, and examples
Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, or maintain a product or service
The practice of customizing documentation or software with a client's branding and visual identity instead of the original provider's
Standard Operating Procedure - detailed written instructions for routine tasks and processes within an organization
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple people to collaborate safely
A structured process for creating, reviewing, approving, and publishing new or updated documentation
The process of adapting documentation or software for different languages, cultures, and regional requirements
The capability to distribute customized documentation to different clients or customer segments simultaneously
Interactive guidance and documentation embedded directly within a software application interface
The process of improving documentation content for better searchability, readability, and user engagement
The systematic control of document creation, storage, retrieval, and distribution throughout an organization
An AI-powered conversational interface that can answer questions and provide assistance automatically
The automatic synchronization of documentation with code changes to keep technical documentation current
